value.title: RSS to JSON pipe copy copy
value.description: Converts RSS to JSON, with user specified count and  RSS URL.

items.title: Girl shot by Taliban reaches UK
items.description: Fourteen-year-old Malala Yousafzai, the Pakistani girl shot in the head by Taliban gunmen, arrives in the UK for medical treatment.
items.y:title: Girl shot by Taliban reaches UK

items.title: Envoy appeals to Iran over Syria
items.description: UN envoy Lakhdar Brahimi appeals for Iranian help to implement a ceasefire in Syria over the Muslim holiday of Eid al-Adha.
items.y:title: Envoy appeals to Iran over Syria

items.title: Skydiver smashes YouTube record
items.description: Austrian skydiver Felix Baumgartner has smashed a number of records, including for views on live streaming.
items.y:title: Skydiver smashes YouTube record

items.title: Nobel Prize in economics awarded
items.description: US academics Alvin Roth and Lloyd Shapley win the 2012 Nobel Prize in economics for their work on the performance of markets.
items.y:title: Nobel Prize in economics awarded

items.title: No winner for Africa leader prize
items.description: There is no winner this year for the world's most valuable individual prize - the Mo Ibrahim prize for good governance in Africa.
items.y:title: No winner for Africa leader prize

items.title: Cambodia's ex-King Sihanouk dies
items.description: Norodom Sihanouk, the former Cambodian king who was a key figure through decades of conflict and upheaval, dies at the age of 89.
items.y:title: Cambodia's ex-King Sihanouk dies

items.title: EU imposes new sanctions on Iran
items.description: EU member states agree a tough new package of sanctions against Iran over its nuclear programme, focusing on banks, trade and gas imports.
items.y:title: EU imposes new sanctions on Iran

items.title: Scottish referendum deal struck
items.description: A deal setting out terms for a Scottish independence referendum is signed by Prime Minister David Cameron and First Minister Alex Salmond.
items.y:title: Scottish referendum deal struck

items.title: Burma bars Islamic office opening
items.description: Burma's president blocks global Islamic body the OIC from opening an office to help Muslims involved in recent violence in the country's west.
items.y:title: Burma bars Islamic office opening

items.title: Savile claims are 'stain on BBC'
items.description: The BBC is criticised by MPs over the Sir Jimmy Savile scandal, with the culture secretary saying a Newsnight investigation into him was "inappropriately dropped".
items.y:title: Savile claims are 'stain on BBC'

items.title: Rolling Stones announce four gigs
items.description: The Rolling Stones announce four concerts in London and New York at the end of the year.
items.y:title: Rolling Stones announce four gigs

items.title: Pilot lands jet at wrong airport
items.description: Indonesian officials suspend a foreign pilot and launch a probe after a passenger jet landed at the wrong airport.
items.y:title: Pilot lands jet at wrong airport

items.title: VIDEO: Costa Concordia captain in court
items.description: The captain of a cruise ship that sunk off the coast of Tuscany, killing 32 people, is appearing before an Italian court.
items.y:title: VIDEO: Costa Concordia captain in court

items.title: VIDEO: Skydiver's chest cam shows spin
items.description: Watch video footage taken from a camera mounted on Felix Baumgartner's chest as he fell to earth from the edge of space.
items.y:title: VIDEO: Skydiver's chest cam shows spin

items.title: VIDEO: Which way does water drain at the equator?
items.description: Does the direction water drains away down a plughole really change according to which side of the equator you are on? Fiona Foster put the Coriolis effect to the test.
items.y:title: VIDEO: Which way does water drain at the equator?

items.title: VIDEO: One-minute World News
items.description: Watch the latest news summary from BBC World News. International news updated 24 hours a day.
items.y:title: VIDEO: One-minute World News

items.title: VIDEO: Cambodia's former king Sihanouk dies
items.description: Norodom Sihanouk, aged 89, was a pivotal figure in Cambodian public life for more than six decades.
items.y:title: VIDEO: Cambodia's former king Sihanouk dies

items.title: VIDEO: Shuttle arrives 12 hrs late on final voyage
items.description: After long delays, the US Space Shuttle Endeavour has finally reached its retirement home at the California Science Center.
items.y:title: VIDEO: Shuttle arrives 12 hrs late on final voyage

items.title: VIDEO: Tajik women face rise in divorce
items.description: Growing numbers of Tajik women are being divorced by husbands working away in Russia, leading to serious social issues.
items.y:title: VIDEO: Tajik women face rise in divorce

items.title: VIDEO: Fish farm thrives in middle of desert
items.description: A fish farm is thriving some of Egypt's most inhospitable land, on the eastern fringe of the Sahara desert.
items.y:title: VIDEO: Fish farm thrives in middle of desert

items.title: Portugal braced for tough budget
items.description: The Portuguese government will present its budget for 2013 later, which is expected to include sharp tax rises and more spending cuts.
items.y:title: Portugal braced for tough budget

items.title: Writedown hits Citigroup profits
items.description: Citigroup's three-month profits plunge to $468m (£291m) from $3.8bn a year earlier after it writes down the value of its stake in a brokerage.
items.y:title: Writedown hits Citigroup profits

items.title: Children in care data found on public PC
items.description: A blogger claims to have accessed data naming New Zealand children currently in care using a "kiosk" computer in the country
items.y:title: Children in care data found on public PC

items.title: Amazon to refund e-book customers
items.description: Amazon contacts some US customers to detail partial refunds for e-books as part of a settlement regarding price fixing.
items.y:title: Amazon to refund e-book customers

items.title: Taken 2 holds on to top film spot
items.description: Liam Neeson film Taken 2 narrowly beats Ben Affleck thriller Argo to stay top of the North American box office.
items.y:title: Taken 2 holds on to top film spot

items.title: Jerry Lee Lewis bandmate killed
items.description: Musician BB Cunningham Jr, a long-time member of Jerry Lee Lewis's band, is shot dead in Memphis, Tennessee.
items.y:title: Jerry Lee Lewis bandmate killed

items.title: Planet with four suns disovered
items.description: Astronomers have discovered a planet whose skies are illuminated by four different suns.
items.y:title: Planet with four suns disovered

items.title: Skydiver surpasses speed of sound
items.description: Austrian Felix Baumgartner becomes the first skydiver to break the speed of sound, reaching a maximum velocity of 833.9mph (1,342km/h).
items.y:title: Skydiver surpasses speed of sound

items.title: Too much sitting 'bad for health'
items.description: Sitting for long periods increases the risk of diabetes, heart disease and death, researchers suggest.
items.y:title: Too much sitting 'bad for health'

items.title: Girl shot by Taliban flown to UK
items.description: Malala Yousafzai, the Pakistani girl shot in the head by Taliban gunmen last week, is flown to the UK for medical treatment.
items.y:title: Girl shot by Taliban flown to UK

items.title: Rooney can get better - Neville
items.description: Ten years after scoring his first Premier League goal, Wayne Rooney can still improve, says Gary Neville.
items.y:title: Rooney can get better - Neville

items.title: Ferrari plan for Vettel arrival
items.description: Ferrari will retain Felipe Massa next season in what is planned to be a stop-gap deal before the arrival of Sebastian Vettel.
items.y:title: Ferrari plan for Vettel arrival

items.title: Elvis Presley's LA home for sale
items.description: The former Beverly Hills home of Elvis Presley is put up for sale for $13m (£8.1m).
items.y:title: Elvis Presley's LA home for sale

items.title: Bill waived after 12qn-euro gaffe
items.description: A woman in south-west France, who mistakenly received a telephone bill of nearly 12 quadrillion euros, has the real amount she owed waived.
items.y:title: Bill waived after 12qn-euro gaffe

items.title: Kenyan official 'hacked to death'
items.description: A Kenyan local government official is killed in what police say is a retaliatory attack following the arrest of secessionist leader Omar Mwamnuadzi.
items.y:title: Kenyan official 'hacked to death'

items.title: Peace plan signed in Philippines
items.description: The Philippines signs a framework peace plan with its largest Muslim rebel group aimed at paving the way for an end to a 40-year conflict.
items.y:title: Peace plan signed in Philippines

items.title: Debate mixes Big Bang and faith
items.description: Cern Scientists meet with philosophers and theologians from the world religions in a meeting that aims to find common ground over the nature of the Big Bang theory.
items.y:title: Debate mixes Big Bang and faith

items.title: Spanish activist jailed in Cuba
items.description: Spanish activist Angel Carromero is jailed for four years in Cuba over a car crash that killed high-profile dissident Oswaldo Paya.
items.y:title: Spanish activist jailed in Cuba

items.title: Six killed in north Iraq violence
items.description: At least six people have been killed in a series of gun and bomb attacks targeting security forces in northern Iraq, officials say.
items.y:title: Six killed in north Iraq violence

items.title: US cruiser hits nuclear submarine
items.description: A US cruiser collides with a nuclear submarine during naval exercises off the Atlantic coast, reportedly causing damage to sonar equipment.
items.y:title: US cruiser hits nuclear submarine

items.title: 'Wonderful family' killed in fire
items.description: A woman and four of her children who died in a house fire in Essex were part of a "wonderful family", friends say.
items.y:title: 'Wonderful family' killed in fire

items.title: General resigns over lobbying row
items.description: The president of the Royal British Legion, Lt Gen Sir John Kiszely, resigns over claims he was involved in defence contract lobbying.
items.y:title: General resigns over lobbying row

items.title: Virgin in West Coast route talks
items.description: Virgin Trains will be asked to continue to run services on the West Coast Mainline for at least another nine months following the decision to scrap the latest franchise decision.
items.y:title: Virgin in West Coast route talks

items.title: Scottish Power to raise prices
items.description: Scottish Power becomes the latest energy company to announce a price rise, with gas and electricity bills going up by 7% on 3 December.
items.y:title: Scottish Power to raise prices
